title: Add New Properites to a JavaScript Object
content: You can add new properties to existing JavaScript objects the same way you would modify them
Here's how we would add a bark property to ourDog:
Now when we evaluate ourDog.bark, we'll get this bark, bow-wow.

exercises.instruction: Add a bark property to myDog and set it to a dog sound, such as 'woof'. You may use either dot or bracket notation.

hint: You should add the property bark to myDog
You should not add bark to the initialization of myDog.
